parttime 0.0.1.26
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    Coerce character date representations to parttime objects

    vec_cast.partial_time.character.Rd

    Coerce character date representations to parttime objects

    # S3 method for partial_time.character
vec_cast(x, to, ...)

    Arguments

    x

    Vectors to cast.

    to

    Type to cast to. If NULL, x will be returned as is.

    ...

    For vec_cast_common(), vectors to cast. For vec_cast(), vec_cast_default(), and vec_restore(), these dots are only for future extensions and should be empty.

    Examples

    dates <- c(
  NA,
  "2001",
  "2002-01-01",
  "2004-245", # yearday
  "2005-W13",  # yearweek
  "2006-W02-5",  # yearweek + weekday
  "2007-10-01T08",
  "2008-09-20T08:35",
  "2009-08-12T08:35.048",  # fractional minute
  "2010-07-22T08:35:32",
  "2011-06-13T08:35:32.123",  # fractional second
  "2012-05-23T08:35:32.123Z",  # Zulu time
  "2013-04-14T08:35:32.123+05",  # time offset from GMT
  "2014-03-24T08:35:32.123+05:30",  # time offset with min from GMT
  "20150101T08:35:32.123+05:30")  # condensed form

as.parttime(dates)
#> <partial_time<YMDhms+tz>[15]> 
#>  [1] NA                             "2001+0000"                   
#>  [3] "2002-01-01+0000"              "2004-09-01+0000"             
#>  [5] "2005+0000"                    "2006-01-13+0000"             
#>  [7] "2007-10-01 08+0000"           "2008-09-20 08:35+0000"       
#>  [9] "2009-08-12 08:35:02.880+0000" "2010-07-22 08:35:32+0000"    
#> [11] "2011-06-13 08:35:32.123+0000" "2012-05-23 08:35:32.123+0000"
#> [13] "2013-04-14 08:35:32.123+0500" "2014-03-24 08:35:32.123+0530"
#> [15] "2015-01-01 08:35:32.123+0530" 

if (FALSE) {
### vctrs experiments informing design of parttime ###

# using a rcrd (record) style vector
rcrd_test <- vctrs::new_rcrd(
  fields = list(a = 1:3, b = 4:6),
  class = numeric())

tibble(x = 1:3, y = rcrd_test)
# okay

tibble(x = 1:3) %>% mutate(y = rcrd_test)
# Error: Column `y` must be length 3 (the number of rows) or one, not 2

tibble(x = 1:3) %>% { .$y <- rcrd_test; . }
# okay (stand-in for mutate until dplyr v0.9.0)

}
